plugins.adufour.vars.lang
Class Var<T>

java.lang.Object
  icy.plugin.abstract_.Plugin
      plugins.adufour.vars.lang.Var<T>
Type Parameters:
T -
All Implemented Interfaces:
icy.file.xml.XMLPersistent, icy.plugin.interface_.PluginLibrary
Direct Known Subclasses:
VarArray, VarBoolean, VarEnum, VarFile, VarMutable, VarNumber, VarObject, VarSequence, VarString, VarSwimmingObject
public class Var<T>
extends icy.plugin.abstract_.Plugin
implements icy.file.xml.XMLPersistent, icy.plugin.interface_.PluginLibrary

Vars is a library built on the concept of Java boxed types, but with the following enhancements:

  • Boxed values can be changed (not possible with Java boxed primitives)
  • Pseudo-"Pass-by-Reference" mechanism: a variable may reference another variable
  • A listener mechanism to respond to "valued-changed" or "reference-changed" events
  • A GUI library providing ready-to-use graphical components linked to each variable
  • A VarEditorModel interface allowing to simplify the GUI generation
The Var class is the top-level class of all variables. It is not abstract to provide great flexibility, however specific implementations provide String parsing ability used for XML loading/saving (see parse(String)) and allow to fine-tune the "pass-by-reference" mechanism (see isAssignableFrom(Var)).

Author:
Alexandre Dufour

addListener

public void addListener(VarListener<T> listener)

createVarEditor

public VarEditor<T> createVarEditor()
Creates a new VarEditor object that allows the user to graphically adjust the value of this variable. By default this editor is an empty label for generic types, but this method can be overridden to provide a custom editor

Returns:
the variable editor embarking the graphical component

isAssignableFrom

public boolean isAssignableFrom(Var<?> source)
Checks whether the type of the given variable is equal or extends this variable's type.
If the result is true, then the given variable can become a link source for this variable

Parameters:
source -
Returns:
true if the source type is equal or wider than this variable's type, false otherwise (including if source has null type)

setDefaultEditorModel

public void setDefaultEditorModel(VarEditorModel<T> model)
Sets the default model used to generate the graphical editor for this variable. Note that this model is not used if the createVarEditor() method is overridden to provide a custom editor

Parameters:
model -
See Also:
VarEditorModel

setReference

public void setReference(Var<T> variable)
                  throws java.lang.ClassCastException
Sets the current variable to reference the specified variable (or null to release the reference). If the reference is non-null, the getValue() method will disregard the local value and return the value of the referenced variable

Parameters:
variable - the variable to reference
Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException - if the two arguments are incompatible and cannot be linked

public java.lang.String toString()
